TopicTitle: Axis Binding "Use in Modes" selection won't save.

Articles.Content:
I'm having a problem when trying to adjust the settings for the Axis Bindings.

When you go in to set the bindings, you can the deselect different modes "staging", "docking rotation", and "docking translation", then click accept for that binding to return to the main settings window. Then if I click on the binding again, all of the modes have been turned back on. I haven't been able to make the mode selectors work on any of the axis bindings.

Windows 8 Steam KSP v1.0.0.830 

[output_log.txt](http://wikisend.com/download/163888/output_log.txt)

Hi Felix, can you try rebinding the key, even if it's to the same key as previously, set the modes then click accept? I found it would only stick for me if the key was rebound ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Alright, I've figured out a temporary workaround that people can use for changing the modes for controls since it doesn't appear to work changing them in game.

Open your settings.cfg

Find the control that you want to adjust the operational modes for.

Change the number for modemask in accordance with the table.

Save your setting.cfg. Then when you enter the controls panel in game, you should see the modes reflecting the desired changes.

-1 is the default with all modes enabled

I had the same problem and ended up doing the same thing.

Sal - is there a toggle for primary/secondary? If not do you know what the intended use case is?

There's no toggle, it didn't make it in but it's on my "bother the devs" list for 1.1, the primary and secondary bindings just let you define two keys as one action, you could setup two joysticks I guess, one for rockets and one for planes.
